Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: GSP1971
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend in Rome. It was easy to get to from the airport, just a train ride and couple of subway stops, and it's location next to the Trevi fountain was fantastic. The hotel itself was welcoming and friendly, the staff helpful and the rooms clean and tidy. Great for a two day stay. We had a room on the back of the hotel which had no noise from the busy streets around the Trevi. Hope to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Flooded bathroom in a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jen N
Reviews.Content: Our first hotel upon arriving in Rome; the location was great right on a bustling street. Some noise depending on your unit but we were so tired we slept well. First room given to us (405) was designed without any thought clearly; the bathroom area does not have a glass door and the floor ledge wasn't raised so the entire bathroom was flooded and threatened to reach the carpeted floors. Requested for extra floor mat and even so, both were soaked. It was horrible because you're walking in and out of an extremely wet, slippery and messy bathroom. The hotel was obviously trying its luck with this room, and that wasn't a nice impression really for the number of stars it had. Can't imagine if we were stuck with that slushy and messy bathroom for 3 nights. Spoke to concierge & they changed to another room with bath tub and jacuzzi, room was slightly bigger as well and it made up for the awful 1st night experience. Breakfast was fantastic; various types of ham & salami, cheeses, cakes, cereal. Staff were helpful and courteous but even so, that didn't change the fact that they tried to trap us with a room which was clearly not meant for staying in with the shower they had. To be sure, request for a room with bath tub, or look for another hotel in Trevi area!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mike w
Reviews.Content: Nice friendly staff, tidy rooms. For boutique read small but it's comfortable and pleasant. Being near the Trevi it's fairly busy, very touristy but that said, I had a room overlooking the street and it didn't keep me awake as the glazed windows and black out blinds removed any disturbances from outside. Free wifi. Helpful staff. All in all I'd happily stay here again. One thing I will mention and the reason I have marked them down slightly on cleanliness - the room was cleaned each day while I was there however in the bin in the bathroom I noticed a ladies deodorant that had been disposed of. It was still there when I left. But it didn't bother me and the hotel is certainly clean.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alexei P Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, very good location, kind staff. Special thanks to Lorenzo and the lady who is responsible for breakfasts. As to location, there are lots of places to be seen and a lot of boutiques to be visited.

Reviews.Title: “Location great - but not for taxis”
Reviews.Author: AMD3523
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June 09 for 2 nights. Got taxi from the airport and the driver had problems finding this hotel. He had to get out of the cab and wander around various restaurants asking where the hotel was. I think he also called the taxi rank to ask but my Italian is not good and I think thats what he was trying to tell us. Taxis can't park out side the hotel so you have to walk a bit with your bags. Glad we didn't hire a car at this point as it would have been a nightmare with permits etc. Check in at hotel not terribly welcoming. That said the hotel has a great location and everywhere is easily accessible on foot. About 50 steps takes you to the Trevi fountain. Was concerned from reviews on trip advisor about pickpockets in this area but there was a very strong police presence. Walked up to the spanish steps one evening and there were some young people jamming away on a guitar and it was really atmospheric. Wear comfortable walking shoes and ladies don't forget to check out the 2 shoe shops near the Trevi fountain. I especially liked the one facing the fountain. Would I stay here again....maybe.... but I would look around first.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, walk to everything!”
Reviews.Author: SCAiken
Reviews.Content: Last minute trip to Rome for New Year's. Had a single room, small, but had everything I needed and was cleaned and re-stocked every day. The location of the hotel can not be beat, it is literally 50 steps to the Trevi Fountain. Walk out the door and there are places to eat, shops. Room had a fridge for drinks and snacks. Easy to walk to everything from here. The breakfast had a good selection, ask for an espresso - it's better than the machine. Everyone was smiling and helpful. It is a tiny hotel and they've made everything fit but I will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: M. P Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is perfect for a stay in Rome, great location close to Trevi fontaine, spanish steps, pantheon and in walking distance to the vatican and the colloseum, great rooms and nice friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Mboj
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and it was a wonderful expierence. The location was amazing, just steps from the trevi fountain and within walking distance to so many spots. In the 2 days we did not use a bus train or taxi other than to and from the airport. The hotel staff were very nice and very helpful. We had two rooms (one was upgraded to a deluxe) They were both very comfortable, clean and I thought quite large for European standards. The beds were a little hard (but I don't like a soft bed), and the pillows were fluffy. The breakfast had plenty to choose from and my only complaint was that the coffee machine was weak. However, when we did mention this the woman working, she made us a nice strong cup of espresso. This was a last minute trip in January and we got a great rate on 2 rooms. Next time we are in Rome we would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT WEE SPOT!”
Reviews.Author: jeremy c
Reviews.Content: great location-just around the corner from the Trevi fountain and 5 mins walk from Via Condoti and Piazza Novonna a lot of these hotels in city centres are rabbit huches but not Trvi-we were on the 5th floor with balcony overlooking the busy streets below and the room was a good size-not a suite but enough room for us. good bathroom facilities and very clean. Breakfast was usual continental buffet affair and adequate only minus point was the TV was supposed to have some english channels but didnt (but then who needs TV in the eternal city anyway?!)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location !!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: football60
Reviews.Content: This hotel was such a perfect location that we didn't mind that the beds were a little uncomfortable and the room was small. This hotel is just up from the trevi fountain just a two minute walk. The street that it is in was so pretty I would spend my most treasured moments looking out the window down the street. The gentleman at the counter was lovely, very helpful. We also found the best spaghettaria L'achetto close by. Lovely food and cheap prices. Just ask at the counter and they will point you in right direction to spaghettaria. Our room was not at all noisy. I had read I other reviews that they were but once windows and shutters are closed you can't hear a thing. Breakfast room very tiny but hey, this was in the centre of Rome. Not much space available there. We stayed four days and it was a great start to our Itailain holiday. Close to everything. We just wondered the streets and came across everything, Pantheon, Spanish Steps, Piazza Navone. There is a great little supermarket/coffee bar on the street as well, makes the best pannini for lunch and sells tooth paste or shampoo as well if you run out or miss place them like we did. I travelled with my husband and 12 year twin boys and they loved it too.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience and stay”
Reviews.Author: BlueVoyageOR
Reviews.Content: Very unfriendly receptionist who would bang the front desk counter with his fist any time we would ask him a question. Dirty carpets in the room, no blanket on the bed just a sheet (in frigid december), uncomfortable mattress, sink cracked in the bathroom and the list goes on and on. I cannot understand how this hotel can be a 4 stars. A huge disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: FLcmm
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location. It is steps away from the Trevi Fountain and walking distance to other sites! We had a room that overlooked the busy street but when the windows were closed you couldn't hear the noise. The room also had a mini bar and wired internet access for a fee. Staff was helpful and friendly. Breakfast was also included and had a good selection of pastries. The only con I can think of is the hotel is on a street where cars can't drive through so the taxi had to drop us off on the next block and we had to walk with all our luggages. It was a great value for the location!

Reviews.Title: “Solid Value”
Reviews.Author: Taryn E
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights during the end of June with my girlfriend on a trip of Italy. We actually upgraded to this hotel in fear of staying at one of the "nightmare" hotels we saw on tripadvisor. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful - we had some problems with our safe which were promptly resolved. The continental breakfast was exactly that....simple but filled with the basics to start your day. Food was fresh and never re-heated. The room was an ice box (refreshing considering the mid-summer heat) and a little crammed, but had every we needed. Bed was on the firm side - but we slept great. Only real knock was the bathroom (shower stall). I understand the European system of saving space by eliminating a bath tub...however the platform does nothing in regards to retaining water. You will need towels and lots of them. If you want a clean, safe hotel with a fantastic location (30 second walk to the Trevi Fountain) - we would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: andiamo2day
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for the location and pushed my budget a little but it was worth it. I liked this hotel enough to book my Mother and Step Father in this hotel for their trip to Rome. The room was not very big but the it was nicely furnished and I was very comfortable. Breakfast was your typical breakfast in Europe. I was in Rome alone and had a problem with one of the street merchant guys that bug you at Trevi Fountain follow me. I was scared and ducked into my hotel and hid near the reception desk and the desk clerk went outside and confronted the guy who was following me. He told the guy that he needed to leave. I didn't have any further problem after that. Oh the only negative thing I could give for this hotel is that I believe they allow smoking in the hotel. Someone was smoking on my floor and the smoke did bothering me. Otherwise a great place to stay in Rome. It was surreal to wake up and walk a few short steps to see Trevi everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Hospitality could have been better”
Reviews.Author: IrishSodaBread
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 night stay at Boutique Hotel Trevi. Shared a triple room with friends. Can't really fault the room itself, it served our needs (other than the fact that you had to hold the shower head in your hand, but we didn't ask for it to be fixed). Tea / Coffee making facilities would have been nice. Didn't hear a sound from the busy street below, which was great. The only thing that I would have an issue with is the lack of duvet cover over the duvets. There was just a sheet on the bed with a bare duvet over it. God knows when or if those duvets ever got cleaned. It didn't bear thinking about who slept under the same duvet previously without a cover. If you weren't dizzy from the twisty walk down to breakfast, it served our needs adequately. Decent coffee would have been a nice start to the day but as no-one greeted or spoke to us at breakfast, you could only presume that the awful coffee from the vending machine was the only option. The staff at reception were not the friendliest. As we only really went to the hotel each evening to sleep, it served our purpose fine. However, it was quite expensive for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SueStr
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked this hotel after spending hours trying to decide where to stay on our first visit to Rome. We were pleased with our choice. The location of this hotel is fantastic and lots of attractions in easy walking distance. After an eight our flight delay and soaked with rain we were delighted to receive a warm welcome by the reception staff and bags taken to our room by a Porter. Our room was spacious with excellent soundproofing. Decor was in keeping with the Roman theme. Only faults with the room were thelack of tea/ coffee facilities and our shower head holder was broken. We didn't bother complaining as these were not a huge issue with us. Breakfast was fine for our needs. A variety of meats and vegetarian options, alongside various sweet choices. On checking out, the reception staff asked if we wanted to use their taxi service. This cost fifty euros and well worth the money. We got there stress free and in a nice Mercedes salon. This wasn't a cheap hotel. However, we would definately return to Rome and stay again at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our last leg of our honeymoon in Rome. The location is excellent, within walking distance to the major historic sites and good dining. Unfortunately our room was very dirty when we arrived, dust bunnies along the floor, the walls are covered in fabric and were stained and you can see where the leaks ran down from the ceiling. The tiles surrounding the bathtub caulking were mouldy and our bidet leaked. Not sure if it is only our room (room 401) but due to this we will not stay here again. Also the breakfast room is in the basement of the hotel and it is not well kept either. They did not change the table linens between guests so we ate among stained tablecloths.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AlparslanT
Reviews.Content: there is nothing more to say. nice place, good service, very good breakfast and excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Blancadaniela
Reviews.Content: I had a hard time trying to choose the hotel for our stay in Rome, I review lots and lots of hotels including the best ranked hotels in trip advisor, and lots of hotels following the rank, a travel agency recomended this hotel and I hasitated from the fact that the hotel was not in the best hotels ranked in TA, but I view all the pictures from other travelers and decided to choose it. And it didn't disapoint, good price, great location, clean hotel, and a beautifull room, we had a room in the second floor and it was very pretty, it was just the room i wanted, its romantic and one of a kind, room is big and comfortable (considering that you are in Rome), bathroom is nice and a lot of complimentary amenities. The room was on the street side and you could open the windows and contemplate the busy street, across the stret from the hotel there's a nice convenience store and restaurants, and of course steps away from trevi fountain, shuttle bus stops and main avenues, and you can take a nice walk to from the hotel to all the main piazzas, piazza spagna is very convenient, also pantheon, piazza navona is the one that is the longest walk but walk is worth it. Breakfast at the hotel was very good they had a big buffet bar, the biggest we had in our stay in Europe, and breakfast room is very pretty. Overall we loved it and even when I made a exaustive review of hotels, including the top 50 in TA, we chose this one, ranked in the 200 and it didn't disapont. Loved it! hope it will keep going up in the rank.

Reviews.Title: “A Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: ishkhanna1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the suite of this hotel paying 580 euros per day, for three days. Except for the location, so near Trevi Fountain, it was a rip off. The room did not have basic facilities like Tea/Coffee Making, or an Iron. Breakfast room was crowded and one had to wait. The dining tables in the breakfast room were so small that two tea cups would fill the table. Toast had to be ordered and came after a wait of 30 mins, chilled ofcourse. Bottom line is it was a Rip Off, at this price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, poorly maintained”
Reviews.Author: M H
Reviews.Content: Too bad, the location could make this a great place. Stayed in a single room (#506) for one night...here's my take... Pros: outstanding location steps from Trevi Fountain, fairly quiet in room #506 (faced back of hotel), affordable, nice small balcony, bed reasonably comfortable, bathroom clean, easy to find & staff helpful when asked a specific question. Cons: my room floor was visibly dirty (not vaccumed), leak in shower hose had water everywhere & all over floor, tiny shower in single room, breakfast looked sketchy so I skipped it (may have been great, but...) and the bed sheets, while clean, had stains. Really wanted to love this place because of the location, but couldn't get past the cleanliness issue.

Reviews.Title: “What a Little Gem of a Place”
Reviews.Author: mbpalmer
Reviews.Content: For our last night in Rome, we searched to find, a Hotel, that would be suitable for my partner and I, but one that would also be suitable for our family, including three grown-up grand-childrten, who would want to 'Enjoy the night-life' of Rome. We couldn't believe our luck, to find this Hotel, so near the Trevi Fountain, and so walkable to all the delights of Rome. We had booked dinner at La Scalelta, and we walked there and back. The staff were very helpful, and courteous, and met every request willingly. The breakfast was a bit disappointing, and there wasn't a vegetarian option, or gluten free, however, we were towards the end, and perhaps the staff, in dining room, may have been a bit more cheerful and obliging if we'd arrived at the start. The breakfast room decor could do with a bit of a make-over as well. They minded our luggage on the Sunday, and my partner left all his computer cables etc., in our room, and the cleaner gave them to one of my family, who was last to leave. We would definitely return to this little gem, in the very heart of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Trevi in Rome, Italy”
Reviews.Author: DogloverRestonVA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Trevi with my family and loved it. The staff was welcoming and helpful with all of our questions. It is just around the corner from the Trevi Fountain and within walking distance to many sights. Stayed across the street in a family room with 2 twins and a double bed. Very comfortable and quiet. Would recommend the hotel for anyone looking for a hotel that has easy access to sights throughout Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and brilliant staff”
Reviews.Author: european_lc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our last night in the city. Location is fantastic, literally one minute down the street from the Trevi fountain and well within walking distance for everything else. The staff are fantastic, can't praise them enough. Very helpful and friendly and no request was any trouble for them. The only criticism we had was the damp problem in the breakfast room in the basement, the smell is overwhelming. Didn't notice this anywhere else though. Room was very clean and comfortable, the terrace had a great view of the city. Worth doing as other reviews here suggest and sneak out at 6am to have your own personal view of the Trevi fountain - rather than with the thousands of others there almost every other hour of the day! Would defintely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Siriaca
Reviews.Content: Great hotel within walking distance of major attractions. Our family of 8 had great time, great service. Rooms are beautiful, and breakfast was nice. Location can't be beat! There's a McDonalds a few steps away for the homesick.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MINORGIRLS5JEG
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a pedestrian only street just yards from the Trevi Fountain. We found the room big enough for two ladies with a terrace that looked out on the street and one window that opened onto the rooftops. The bath was spotless but no place to put your "stuff". The breakfast was your usual hotel fare , eggs, cheese, meat, pastry, cereal etc. I must say that everyone in the hotel was always very corteous to us , answered all our requests, called taxis and made reservations. This was our most expensive hotel on our trip and I think the room could use some sprucing up( the two lights on the wall on either side of our headboard were loose and we had to prop them on the headboard so they wouldn't fall over and the bracket that held the hairdryer was loose. We would stay there again if we could book it for less.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: Europe-07-09-11
Reviews.Content: Just an absolutely great location. Right at the Trevi fountain and near loads of shopping and flea markets. An easy walk to almost every attraction in Rome. We didn't need a single taxi, bus or train. Colleseum was the farthest at maybe 15 to 20 minute walk tops. Not the best facilities but the rest made up for it. The moment you walk out of the hotel you are in the mix of it all. There is a little shop just across the door with water for less than a Euro, wine for less than 10E, soft drinks and snacks as well. Everytime I went in there the proprietor was offering a wine or food tasting as well. That's the best shop I've been to in Europe for service and prices and is a huge plus for the hotel. The hotel has a refrigerator so it's great to have cold water and beer on hand. The McDonalds is right there too and that's a funny experience. Went there for lunch to save money and it took almost 30 minutes and it wasn't crowded. An English family behind us and my family had to start laughing at the absurdity of it. The folks behind the counter were just literally chatting away having a great time. I recommend it for the experience. Plus after so much pasta and other carbs, a burger was worth the effort. Last thought, the hotel delivers the free breakfast to your room at no charge. Very nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Tarted up Old Lady”
Reviews.Author: milo-tb
Reviews.Content: We were checked into this hotel although we had reserved a room at the Hotel Pinciana of the same hotel group, Leonardi. We had booked a charged limousine transfer but nobody was at the airport to pick us up. After calling the Pinciana they told us about the sudden relocation and that there is no transfer arrangement although we had a written confirmation in our hands! After another 50 min. we were picked up. We were brought to the Trevi hotel which is very close to the Trevi Fountain in the midst of buzzing noisy Rome in a narrow little lane. Some people might like this, we did not. Nevertheless the location allowed us to reach many of the famous tourist attractions by food. Our so-called Junior suite made an overall grubby, dark and cramped impression. The mattress had no mattress cover and there was no duvet but just a top sheet. The only wardrobe in the room was extremely tiny but contained 2 extra pillows and a safe that did not work. We could not unpack our suitcases at all as there was just no space. It was impossible to sleep without ear plugs as it was so noisy in the street directly below our window. The bathroom was also very compact, bigger people might have a problem to fit into the tiny tub. The shower pole fell off the wall, everything was badly maintained. The sealing between the tub and the wall looked like used chewing gum and was about as useful. The internet which was placed on a little desk in the small anteroom did not work. The carpet in both rooms looked filthy. Breakfast was served in a little room in the basement, selection was alright for Rome, you had to get your coffee yourself from the coffee dispenser. The bell boy and receptionists were friendly but we had the feeling that they did not hear our complaints for the first time but were obviously instructed to tell the guests they will take care of the issues - but they did not. The hotel claimed to be a "4 Star Superior" which is not justified at all in our opinion. Our impression was that the owners do not want to make any major investments in this hotel although the potential was definitely existing. They have tried to "tart-up" an old lady (which might have seen better times) and position it as an elegant hostess (Boutique Hotel). We will definitely not recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “small but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: lorjim
Reviews.Content: We found Boutique Hotel Trevi a comfortable and luxurious hotel, very centrally located on the doorstep of the Trevi fountain. Having read the reviews we were nervous our reservation would be there and to be sure we did reconfirm several days before. When we arrived there was no problem and we were shown immediately to our rooms. The rooms are beautifully furnished in that old world elegance of silk and dark wood. Our room was small by North American standards but big enough for a queen sized bed and a full bath. My girlfriend’s was much smaller as she had a single. There was a small elevator but as I am claustrophobic I was relieved to see the hotel had central open stairs up to our room. The breakfast room is in the basement and the buffet is quite substantial. What made our visit was the staff. They were all so friendly and accommodating. The front desk gave us advice on restaurants, shopping and generally how to get around Rome and the serving staff at breakfast were very attentive. While there are crowds outside the hotel door( and I mean crowds, the Trevi Fountain is one of the most popular tourist destinations in Rome) the hotel is very quiet inside and we had no problem sleeping. Considering it is a four star hotel we were surprised to find that the hotel does not have wireless net service but does have plug in for your laptop or you can use a very cumbersome tv internet system for which they charge you a daily fee. As we were using i-phones we were disappointed. This was our first visit to Rome and as hotels go this was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better!”
Reviews.Author: snoopy7982
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at this wonderful hotel. I was hesitant because of some of the reviews here, but I'm so glad that I booked anyway. The front desk was helpful and gracious. We arrived early morning and they had our room ready within 20 minutes. The room was small but very typical of European hotels. The housekeeping was amazing. Location is perfect and we walked everywhere. My only complaint was that breakfast was served in the basement and the smell was horrible. A moldy, musty sour smell. It would not deter me from staying here again. In fact, we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rojoe523
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boutique Hotel Trevi for two nights and loved it. We got to the hotel at 10am and our room was ready for us. Great way to start our stay. The location is perfect and the hotel is very clean. The staff was very nice and easy to talk to.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret..SSHHH...”
Reviews.Author: Footeloose53
Reviews.Content: Four of us girlfriends stayed here for a few days before a cruise. We paired up and shared a double. This is one of the BEST little hotels I have stayed in. Rome is known for tiny rooms...These were wonderful! LOCATION LOCATION!!! There was even a small balcony that over looked the cute little street below, just around the corner and there was the fountain! We visited it at 6:00 in the morning just to get there before the crowds and it was so peaceful( could have gone in pjs it's that close!)! They were just turning the water on...saw a fashion model during a photo shoot..The employees at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. Would book this hotel again in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Beware they didn't have a room for us!!”
Reviews.Author: Alidee77
Reviews.Content: We arrive about 6pm planning to stay for three nights at this hotel. When we arrived we were told there was a problem and there was not a room for us. They wanted to send us to a sister hotel which looked miles away on the map which I did not accept, we had a heated discussion and he finally offered us another hotel not far from where we were which we had to take, it wasn't as nice. The next day we were moved back to the Boutique Trevi hotel an although we had a very bad start to our weekend, I must admit that it was a nice hotel in an excellent position about 50 yards from the trevi fountain, stalls, shops and resturants, and walking distance the major sites. We were given a bottle of wine and an afternoon snack free. Its a nice hotel in a great positon but beware about them not having a room for you.!

Reviews.Title: “Experience Rome and stay in a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: karran10rodes
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome in five days and stayed at the Boutique Hotel Trevi, and we were very pleased with the hotel. The room was nice and clean, the bathroom was good with the bubble bath. We got all our wishes fulfilled, including the balcony we wanted with the view to the street Via delle Murat. It was very quiet at night even that the hotel is right next to the Trevi Fountain, but when we closed the balcony door, we heard nothing. Breakfast was good. It is not intended that the hotel must have so much food for breakfast so you do not need to eat all day, you who are complaining should remember that it is only a breakfast and it was really good and enough at the hotel. The location is absolutely the best in Rome. All the staff were very nice and helpful. This is a hotel with very good standard. We have stayed at other hotels in Rome, also close to Trevi, and there they were very unpleasant. We can honestly recommend this hotel, and next time we will stay again at the Boutique Hotel Trevi. There are cheaper hotel but if you want to stay at the hotel with good standard should be chosen this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware! They overbook all the time and send you to another hotel!”
Reviews.Author: k_norrman23
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Rome with my husband and 4 other people. I studied in Rome years ago when I was in college so I know the language, and the area. We booked this hotel because of it's great location and didn't mind that it wasn't too fancy. We arrived close to midnight and the night staff is TERRIBLE!!! The night guy is such a liar! When we arrived they said they didn't have rooms for us in the hotel but that we would be switched to a sister hotel "very close, 5 minutes" We asked if we could walk since we didn't have that much luggage. He laughed and said "No, very close 5 minutes by car" Then he proceeded to lie about the new hotel's location three times and we come to find out it is past Porta Pia and about a 15 minute taxi ride away. We never would have booked this hotel since it's too far from city centre. He then kept trying to make it sound better with lies like, "You'll like this new hotel better, it's newer", "The Trevi Fountain is closed at night anyway you can't go see it now" (IT's an outdoor fountain, it doesn't close!" Finally we agree to go to the new hotel for that night only if we can come back in the morning to stay in the original hotel for the remainder of the stay. He books us a taxi to take us to the new hotel and we had to wait for over an hour for the taxi to come, then when two small taxis came instead of one van taxi to take all six of us, he sent them away because he didn't want to pay for two and told us they weren't our taxis, which was another lie. THen he called another taxi and it took another 45 minutes. When we finally were in the taxi he laughed and said sorry for the inconvenience, yeah right. The next morning we had Thomas Cooke call on our behalf, since we booked through them. Luckily we were "upgraded" and were able to stay at the original hotel for the remainder of the trip. I don't know if we would have been so lucky if Thomas Cooke didn't call for us. Once we were in the right hotel, and no longer had to deal with the night staff, we were very pleased with the hotel. The rooms are nice and clean, the day staff is friendly and helpful and the location is great. Just beware that you may not be getting the hotel you paid for. I definitely wouldn't chance it if you're only staying for one or two nights, it's too much of a hassle to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: lakefront
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was very nice. The guys at the front desk were very helpful, always spoke when you were going in and out of the hotel. Our room was large and clean. Large bathroom. Nice windows that opened in our room facing the street. Very close to the Trevi Fountain, so very crowded, although our room was very quiet. Nice neighborhood, with easy to access other areas of Rome. We walked everywhere. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Lovely20
Reviews.Content: This hotel was situated not even 50m from the Trevi Fountain and was easily accessible using public transport from the airport, if you don't have too much luggage. I had a single room, it was tiny, I had a family member assist me to get to the hotel, and when we were both in the room with my luggage, there wasn't too much room to move, but it was all part of the charm. My only qualm was that the bathroom and some of the corridors throughout the hotel had a mildew smell which my cousin said was what you find in old buildings in Rome. Apart from the bathroom (I learned to keep the door closed at night) I could not find fault with this hotel. The room was beautiful, albeit small. As it was an internal room it was very quiet and I enjoyed that I was able to open the doors, and not rely on airconditioning. I found the reception staff to be efficient and friendly. The staff at breakfast didn't really converse with anyone I recall being greeted only on one of the 3 days I had breakfast in the breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother with this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dwjarrow
Reviews.Content: This is not a Boutique Hotel. It is a small Hotel, with no Public area, lounge or bar.Our room was small although nicely decorated. Over priced and over rated. They double booked our first night of our honeymoon and put is an inferior sister hotel.We were only in Rome for 2 nights, so 1 night in 2 hotels. The staff could not have cared less - go elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but could be even better”
Reviews.Author: dillon2158
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a busy street near the Trevi Fountain - ideally located. Friendly welcome on arrival, lift available. Rooms were on the back of the hotel so they were quiet, views were of roof tops. Rooms are cleaned every day but the carpets do need cleaning by professionals! Single rooms are small but as I only slept in the room it was fine. It had averything needed - safe, etc When my room flooded (the water in the hotel had been turned off due to a broken pipe and the staff had left the shower on so when the water supply was reinstated the short shower curtain and shallow shower tray allowed water into my bathroom, bedroom and corridor) the porter was unable to offer anything more than a pack of bath towels to soak up the water and turn on the air-conditioning. I was also asked to help so I requested another room. Unfortunately the hotel was full and another room was not available until the next night - as this was my last night I decided to stay in the room. The hotel did buy me a bottle of wine and apologised. Breakfast - food fine but dreadful coffee, tea, etc. I would stay in this hotel but would not recommend unless carpets were cleaned!

Reviews.Title: “Best in Rome”
Reviews.Author: yuriserruya
Reviews.Content: Excellent price, well furnished rooms, high quality crew, few steps from Fontana di Trevi and awesome restaurant around. When in Rome, stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Not very caring”
Reviews.Author: Flygaal
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online for one night before leaving on cruise and when I arrived after a long journey I was told they had no rooms available but that they can find me another hotel "close" by. I had no choice but to take it because i was exausted and needed to shower and rest. When I arrived to the hotel the hotel was nice yes but a 15 minute bus ride away from the center. The purpose of me choosing hotel trevi was for location because I was there one night only! I didnt stay at the hotel I was sent to. Went online and booked another hotel at the center that was much more expensive and out of my budget. The man at front desk at hotel trevi tried to act like he was nice but It was all a act and he was rude trying to keep me seated in the waiting area so that other guest would not be informed of what was going on. He quickly rushed me out of there and lied and said the other hotel was close by. I just tried to get a refund and the hotel manager refuses to refund me only because I was offered another hotel. Yeah another hotel that I did not stay in or choose to stay in. This hotel a great location but I dont think they handled my problem correctly. I understand thing like this can happen but to want to keep my money and not refund it IS WRONG!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PetuniaNZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in late September. The room we had requested was unavailable so they offered us another room which they called their superior room. We didn't like it at all. It was very dark and didn't feel very clean. When we complained they somehow managed to give us the room which we requested in the first place. It was very nice and light and had a small balcony with one chair on it. The room was clean enough but the carpet was badly stained and felt dirty. So much so that we wore the slippers provided when we were in the room. The hotel is in a great location. A few steps from the Trevi Fountain and a reasonably easy walk to all the other tourist attractions in Rome. Great shopping and restaurants all close by. The breakfast was more than adequate and served in the basement which always smelt musty. Get there early for breakfast as there aren't many tables and not a lot of room. I would recommend this hotel for a short stop in rome but mainly for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Aside from no ice, this place is nice!”
Reviews.Author: kigbuzzard
Reviews.Content: The only problem was the ice machine was broken. Small price to pay for being situated centrally to nearly everyting in Rome: 15 paces from Trevi; 15-20 minute walk from the Forum; 30 minute walk from Vatican. The staff was excellent and helpful. Great room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, central location and good standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: tumtum9
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its central location and were not disappointed - most main attractions are within walking distance. In general the staff were friendly and professional. The room was of a good standard - well air conditioned and well sound-proofed from the bustling streets outside. The breakfast offered was very good although as other reviews have mentioned the breakfast room is small so with a toddler (no high chairs available) and small baby, we opted to have breakfast served in our room after the first day - no extra cost - and this worked fine for us.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, Ideal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMat007
Reviews.Content: This hotel provided a perfect four star experience. A clean and modern, air conditioned (July in Rome!!) room, in the heart of the city. I travel frequently to Rome and stay on the weekends, and found this hotel to be the best I've yet experienced for balancing quality, price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service.”
Reviews.Author: mikeyHongKong
Reviews.Content: My family and I had 3 nights here in July and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. This hotel is small but well run. It is perfect for shopping, walking around the major sights or getting on and off the sight seeing buses and there are plenty of good restaurants within 15 minutes walk for all budgets. Downside is noise during the day particularly if you have a 1st floor room and small breakfast room. Upside is location, cleanliness and good service from staff. Breakfast is continental but offers hardbolied eggs, hams etc - plenty to eat - altho a tad cramped. We were grateful for trip adviser recommendations. There is no vehicular access so taxis will drop you about 1 minute away. Thanks to the staff especially Caterina and and the bellman whose name I forget but who was cheerful, helpful and hardworking.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: gillydugan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with husband and 2 teenaged children for 4 nights in June. This was our third trip to Rome and we choose this hotel for location and also because family rooms were available. Firstly, I really struggle with the concept that this is a hotel - I consider it to be a b&B. What you are buying is a room with breakfast facilities in the basement - there is no bar, seating areas and despite the misleading pictures on the web site, THERE IS NO TERRACE!. The picture shown is a terrace from one of the rooms. Had I known the hotel had no terrace I would not have chosen to stay here. We booked with "Easy to book.com" and they assured me that the room had double bed and queen size sofa bed so could accomodate 4 people. However, this was not the case as the sofa bed was single. The hotel staff provided another single bed but this resulted in really cramped conditions. In addition, room only had one single wardrobe which had a pull out rail, which meant we couldn't unpack for the entire stay. In short, location could not be faulted, but i would not choose to stay here again. Much preferred Colonna Palace. Probably the only hotel I have ever stayed in where I have not been asked on check out how our stay was - yes staff could learn a lot about customer service. When we enquired about transport to airport, they offered us hotel car at a special rate - 15 euros more than we had paid on way there! Book your airport transfers in advance with Rome cabs - they really provide an excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: jae351
Reviews.Content: This location is superb! A very short walk to the Trevi... the street outside is buzzing with people late into the evening but we never heard a thing from our room on the 5th floor. We LOVED this hotel... the staff was very friendly, helpful and excellent assistance with maps, bus and train schedules. The room was large with a nice size bathroom and a jetted tub! Was very nice to have after a long long day of walking the city! Excellent in room internet - the only downfall (if you can even call this a downfall!) was that there was only 1 internet connection per room and it would have been nice for both my friend and I to be able to be online at the same time in the evening hours to catch up with our families. We had 2 twin beds - comfortable. Room - clean and very comfortable Breakfast - average. Location - THE BEST!

Reviews.Title: “Right in the action”
Reviews.Author: Wanderer039
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 4 nights in the Boutique Trevi. It is in a fabulous, central position, 5 doors from the Trevi Fountain. The street is pedestrian only and buzzes night and day with life. From our little balcony on the 5th floor, we could listen to accordion players in the street below and look at the rooftops of Rome. When it came to going to sleep, the double glazed doors and heavy curtains shut it all out. Bliss! The staff were polite, but were slow to rectify some maintenance issues (shower curtain and towel rail falling off and security shutter handle broken). The room was not large, but comfortable and the breakfast delicious. The staff organised a car to the airport for us at a lower rate than we could by internet. So much of Rome is well within walking distance from this hotel, so even though it is expensive, it is well worth it to have all of Rome right there at your doorstep. It has pay as you go internet at reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cozyspy
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Boutique Hotel Trevi in March 2010. The Room we had was very cute and clean and even had a small terrace overlooking the rooftops of Roman buildings, which was nice to relax on. The Hotel is in a prime location, very central, by the trevi fountain and when my wife and i first arrived we were worried that it would be too loud (it is on a main street to the Trevi fountain and tons of tourists and party travelers seemed to be passing by as we entered). We were very pleasantly surprised to find that the rooms were actually quite quiet. The rooms were clean, and the staff was very friendly and obliging. the only thing I would say is that the beds are a little harder than i am used to, but we slept well anyway (could be from exhaustion, but still counts) Thank you to everyone at the BHT!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LinguineLover
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights, terrific stay. The bed could have been softer but that is my only complaint. The staff was charming, the location is perfect, and the amenities were great. Includes lavish breakfast. This hotel is right in the center of heavy pedestrian traffic and I heard nothing in my room. The hotel is very posh in an understated way. Fine linens, attractive marble, and very clean. The restaurants nearby are delicious and reasonable. There is a grocery catty corner from the actual fountain that is reasonable and delicious. The local owners of the restaurant and grocery are very personable. I would stay here again and recommend this to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: gwyni
Reviews.Content: Less than 100m from the Fontana de Trevi this is an excellent hotel to stay in the heart of Rome. Occupying 6 floors, the rooms are nicely decorated with a decent size bathroom. The rooms were clean & the sheets were changed after 2 days. Breakfast is plentiful, with a good selection of pastries,cold meats,cheeses etc. The staff were very helpful-their restaurant recommendation was a great success. I am sure there are better hotels in the heart of Rome, but as a value for money base for your trip I can recommend this little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for visiting the major tourist sites”
Reviews.Author: uvagrad
Reviews.Content: We found the Boutique Hotel Trevi through American Express. It is located on a pedestrian only street which is next to the Trevi Fountain, the Via Delle Muratte.The location was PERFECT for touring- really centrally located to all the tourist sites- we walked EVERYWHERE, never took a cab except to and from the airport and to and from the train station when we were leaving for Venice and had luggage. When we opened our windows, we could hear the splashing of the Trevi Fountain- charming! We loved being in "the center of the action" and we actually liked the fact that there were always loads of people around-it was lively and fun! But if you don't like that then this isn't the spot for you- it definitely is not secluded. There are always a lot of people around the Trevi Fountain until late at night, and its a boisterous place- no cars, but lots of people having fun! And this was in the first week of March, I can only imagine how many people are around during the true tourist season! You could definitely hear the "people noise" when the windows were open- but when you closed the windows it completely blocked the sound- it was actually pretty amazingly soundproof, and the rooms seemed to be also- we never heard anyone and there were other people staying in the rooms on the small hall. We were on the fourth floor of the hotel and that probably helped a little. Our window views were charming street views and views of the terra cotta rooftops- which we loved. The lower floors would be looking into other people's windows of the buildings across the street so I'd recommend asking for a higher floor (there are 5 floors in the hotel, i'd ask for 4th or 5th floor) The only inconvenient thing about the hotel was that taxis could not drive you to the hotel-the closest they could park was at one end or the other of the street. This really wasn't a problem, though- the hotel staff is obviously used to it, and the driver that we hired (Romacabs-excellent- i'll review separately) had no trouble finding it. He called the hotel when we got there and they sent bellhops for our luggage. The hotel itself was great. The front desk staff were friendly. When we first got there (early in the am due to flight) they were happy to store our luggage until they got the rooms ready, and gave us early check ins, which were most appreciated! The rooms were exactly as they appear on the website (charming, not cookie cutter!). Although they are somewhat small by american standards, they aren't too small for two people and their luggage. The only down side-the bathrooms have a tub/shower combination that i think was inserted over the original fixture, with a shower curtain and for some reason it tends to leak, wetting the bathroom floor significantly- not a huge problem but one that we experienced in both rooms so i think it must have something to do with the construction of the bath/shower combination. They had all the standard bath amenities except robes- slippers, hairdryers, shampoo, bath gel, soap, lotion, shaving kits, toothbrush/toothpaste kits, mending kits, shower caps,anything used replaced daily) Flat screen plasma TVs, internet (we didn't use, had our blackberries so can't comment on speed). The beds were very firm (which i liked, one of our sons didn't). We had a king bed room and one with two twins for our sons (the "king" was really just two twins pushed together but that was OK, there was no "gap" between them) Beds were long enough for us ( my husband and teenaged sons are 6'5", 6'2" and 6'1" respectively so this is a problem sometimes) Closet with nice hangers, full length mirrors, writing desk, safe, mini bar- good housekeeping services done timely) Breakfast was downstairs in a small but charming area, standard continental fare. You could also have room service delivered free of charge. The area seemed to be very safe and was well-traveled. We never felt any hesitation or worries about walking around in the area at night and were never hassled by anyone. There were several little pharmacies and grocery stores in the area to pick up drinks, sandwiches, snacks, etc. and several inexpensive, casual and good restaurants on the little side streets once you passed the obvious tourist restaurants (which may have been OK too, we just didn't try them) The hotel staff was nice about recommending some local trattorias and we had some great meals there! All in all- we had a great experience there. I'd highly recommend it to anyone who wants a boutique hotel experience right in the middle of the action and conveniently located to all the tourist sites (and the best gelato in Rome, San Crispino!) :) I would not recommend it if you are looking for a secluded spot that is "off the beaten track".

Reviews.Title: “Great location - small rooms, overall it was above my expectations”
Reviews.Author: yanka7
Reviews.Content: We didn't expect much from the hotel, as our main criteria for selecting it was the location. Our first room was very small and very dark (despite 2 windows). We could barely walk around the bed. The front desk manager was professional and friendly, and moved us to another room, larger in size. It was cozy, with good bed, flat screen TV on the wall and good size bathroom. We really liked the wood paneling on the walls, it brought the sense of old world charm. Our window was facing the street that was leading to the Fontana de Trevi. With windows open, we could hear the water, it was great. On the down-side: 2 times the room wasn't cleaned by 3:00 PM and we had to complain to the front desk. We travel a lot, and know our way around, so we didn't seek any advise from the concierge. Speed of the internet was pretty good (we had our laptop). One afternoon they had problem with a provider, but it was quickly fixed. There was something wrong with the heating system in the room, as it was always hot, despite our effort to adjust the thermostat. After talking to the front desk, they have adjusted the temperature from the main computer, so our room was comfortable. Overall, we had a good experience, considering that this is a 4 star hotel. I would probably stay there again and recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ciarán
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week for 3 nights..absolutely fab hotel..people cannot possibly give out about this place..it amazes me that people can be so picky...it was a perfect central location to get to all the main sights..the lads at reception were sound guys..very helpful...from this hotel the trevi fountain is only a min away..also pantheon, colesseum etc are walkable too..rooms are cosy and very clean..breakfast downstairs did the job..we'll defo stay here again

Reviews.Title: “They just couldn´t care less”
Reviews.Author: PerAsperaAdAstra11
Reviews.Content: Positive: - Central location from where it is easy to orientate and walk everywhere. - The luggage porter was the only staff person who presented you a welcoming feeling, was friendly and helpful. - Massaging bath tube: comfortable after a day´s walking but terribly noisy. Negative: - Attention/hospitaity to the guest: I had my 50th birthday anniversary and told it to them in advance, asking for advise for concerts/tours/etc. whatever to do in the evenings. But they couldn´t care less. Nobody even congratulated me: no the reception guy who handled my pre-booking and took my passport (with this date), not his colleague giving my passport back the next day. Usually hotels all over the world congatulate somehow even if it an annual, regular birthday. - Service attitude: What service? - Information: They don´t know anything what happens in the city, no information/brochures/advise on any cultural events, juts "go and seek it yourself from the (terribly slow and clumsy) internet". The only brochure they had was last year´s brochure of one (1) tour organiser with very limited alternatives. . - Room (single): Smallest ever, dark shades. In the hotel brochure their marketing sentence "in EVERY room there is a splendid view over the rooftops" is a lie: the only "window" opened to an ugly tiny backyard from where you could not see it it is a day or a night. When I told the reception that their comment is untrue they just shaked their shoulders, tobacco smoke came in from somewhere. - Internet: Not available in public area, only in the rooms where you could pay extra trying to use the internet via TV, terribly slow and clumsy mouse, view oversized for the picture so you had to move the arrowas back and forth all the time to see the whole page. - Facilities: The first room they had reserved for me was still uncleaned 7 p, when you arrived so you had to change room. The internet keyboard batteries where old and didn´t work. The batroom light was blinking. - Breakfast: Stuff enough but the tiny and noisy location in the cellar level was not an appealing start for the day, so consider booking breakfast to your room (that was free, a plus). - Price value: So much for next to nothing, they just storage the customers for the nighttime and it is not their headache if you enjoy your trip with maximum potential and have interesting time.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location for a visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Telates
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel this is and what a lovely location. It is truly located around the corner of the Trevi fountain and is within walking distance of Rome's famous landmarks such as Piazza Navona, the Spanish Steps and the Pantheon. It is also about 7 minutes walking from a subway station. The hotel itself is great! Staff is very friendly and speaks good English. The room itself is a bit small but equiped with a plasma tv and minibar. Bathroom has a nice bath with jacuzzi function. The breakfast is ok but can be brought up to the room free of charge, a very nice touch! All in all, a great hotel at an even better location. We kept being surprised how close it was to all the sights. A very heartfelt recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “Flies in the ointment”
Reviews.Author: Niassa
Reviews.Content: My aunt and me have just returned from our Xmas stay in Rome. As it was my aunt's first trip to Rome I've chosen this hotel to be as centrally as possible. I was really going to recommend the hotel. It is very modern, well furnished, clean. The bathroom had bathtub which is not typical for Italian hotels and was a nice thing to have after a long walking day. Breakfast can be served in the room for no extra charge. Good size plasma TV with the choice of TV programes as well as paid movies. Very pleasant front office staff. The thing that we asked for twin room and got one with one double bed didn't put me off. Neither the aircon which had been apparently switched off for the winter (during our stay in Rome the weather was very warm and we needed aircon rather than heating which made the room as hot as oven). What really surprised and upset me was the false charge for minibar. We didn't even open it to say nothing of drinking stuff from it (I never use minibars especially when you can buy whatever you want in the shop next door and so much cheaper!) Our arguments made no difference - they insisted that we had to pay. So petty and unworthy of a place like that. On top of that we realized we were missing some toiletteries of ours! This is really ridiculous! I'm speachless... Overall, the hotel is nice but be ready to lock all your luggage you leave in the room and count everything in minibar as soon as you are introduced into your room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Gorgeous Rooms, Lovely Service!!”
Reviews.Author: sciom
Reviews.Content: We found the Boutique Hotel Trevi 2 weeks prior to our stay as we required two last minute rooms. We decided to stay at this hotel due to the great reviews on trip advisor and we were not dissapointed. We stayed in rooms 502 & 505 on the 5th floor. room 502 was decorated in a light tone with fabric wall paper (very nice). There was a small balcony with a seat outside ( we were not aware of this when we booked the room so was a lovely suprise) when the doors were opened you can hear the trevi fountain which was a nice touch - when doors were shut you could not hear a sound. Room 505 was decorated in a dark mahagony and also had a larger balcony - this overlooks the houses to the back and had no noise at all which was ideal for my mother who stayed in this room. The bathrooms both had a bath with shower, towel heater, large sinks and mirrors and storage space underneath for nick naks. ( very clean). Pairs of slippers were also left and plenty of condements which were replaced everyday. Each room had a mini bar. We only drank fizzy drinks which were about 3 Euros however it costs about 2.50 euros to buy the same drinks from a shop so we felt this was good value. The service was lovely, all the staff were polite and friendly - always saying hello. Beds were comfy - best nights sleep i've had in months. The person cleaning the rooms would fold the pjamas and leave them on your pillow which we felt was a nice touch. The location is brilliant. in the heart of rome - plenty of places to eat nearby,. the main shopping street is a minute walk from the hotel and it took no more than 20 minutes to get to all main locations within the city. We have been to Rome twice now and are planning to return in a couple of years. We will definatley be staying at this hotel on our third visit!!!! Isle of Man visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, brilliant location.”
Reviews.Author: V1K_10
Reviews.Content: Having been to Rome before and having stayed at a 5* hotel, approximately 5-7 miles outside of Rome, I wanted a hotel with a good location this time. I was told about this hotel by my cousin who stayed here a few months before I booked and having now stayed there, I was very glad to have been told about it. We arrived in Rome at about 10am and got to the hotel at around 10.45am. The hotel staff held our luggage for us as we could not check in until 2pm. I also had some medication which needed to be kept cool. The hotel staff offered to keep this medication in the room which had been booked for us. I was very impressed with the way that we were spoken to and helped. Understandably, check in time was at 2pm and so a room could not be offered to us until that time. The location of the hotel was second to none and truely excellent. Right in the middle of all of the attractions and close enough to walk. There is a supermarket literally 5 minutes walk away for any essentials and the Trevi Fountain is less than a minute away. The hotel staff offered to book us on excursions but we didn't take any of these. My advice for Rome would be to que up for the attractions and not to go with tour guides outside. They offer to skip the que etc but in all honesty, we didn't wait for more than 5 10 minutes in any que anyway and so paying the extra amount would have been a waste of money. The main attractions all offer audio guides as well at a cheaper rate and so I would personally take that option. The room was very clean and was nicely laid out. It could have been slightly larger but then to be honest, we didn't really mind as even when we were relaxing in the room, there was more than enough room to do so. All in all, I would deffinately advise to look for a hotel in a good location rather than one which is cheaper in Rome. The location of this hotel is very, very good and so I would deffinately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: gator1350
Reviews.Content: New travelers to Italy. Did a 12-day tour with Globus but went to Rome a day early. Chose the Boutique Hotel Trevi on line based on reading reviews of previous quests. The hotel is steps away from Fountain Trevi and minutes to Pantheon and Place Navona. Needless to say, the location is beyond excellent!! And hotel was wonderful. We e-mailed them to have a car pick us up at the airport and this worked out great. Our hotel room, 501, was beyond our expecations based on some of the reviews we had read. Our room overlooked a pedestrian street with lots of cafes and restaurants. We also had a balcony overlooking rooftops and the street. We bought a bottle of wine and sat out on the balcony and enjoyed our first evening in Rome. If we get back to Rome, we will definitely stay there. We threw our coins in the fountain!! Margie and Fred in Florida

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff, very central and near to many of Rome's historic sites”
Reviews.Author: MaidenCity
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a very enjoyable stay at the Boutique Trevi Hotel to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. The staff were very friendly and helpful and had ensured that the taxi's we'd pre-booked were at the airport ot meet us and to return us in good time for our flight home. The room we were allocated was really beautiful, pannelled, well furnished. We had a jacuzzi bath with overhead shower and contrary to other reviews we'd read before we travelled, the plumbing was perfect. The level of cleanliness was superb, we noticed that the cleaning was supervised every day. The only poor point of the stay was the breakfast-very poor quality, no fresh breads or rolls and a very limited selection of meats and cheese. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to others. S. Higgins. Derry. Northern ireland

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central hotel”
Reviews.Author: RedW
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right next to the Trevi fountain, down one of the main streets off the square. The downside of this is, if you get a taxi from the airport, it can't quite get to the hotel! However, not a big deal. The hotel itself is quiet, clean and has a fairly luxurious feel to it. Our room was on the top floor, and although it was very small there was adequate space for a city break. The bed was very comfy, there was enough wardrobe space (although very few coat hangers!) and despite what some other travellers have written, our bathroom was lovely if prone to flooding when the shower was used. It was extremely peaceful despite its central location which was great. Breakfast is in the basement, get there early to get a table (we had to wait a while one morning). the choice is what I'd expect in a central European hotel - lots of different hams and salamis, some cheese, bread, yoghurt and a small seletion of fruit.

Reviews.Title: “for the same price stay at the Stendhal”
Reviews.Author: Keryn-TRIP
Reviews.Content: No real faults with this hotel, we stayed 3 nights at The Stendhal and 3 nights here, while the location of this one is better as far as attractions, the location of the Stendhal is better for trains, so much of a muchness. Slightly smaller rooms, cleanliness the same, breakfast the same just didn't quite have that nice feel of the Stendhal.

Reviews.Title: “UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCE STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: PETERYAO
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL .The rudest staff i have ever come across. Also the most unhelpful. my friend had just arrived from 20 hours round trip from overseas and before going to his hotel wanted to meet me in my hotel room. the staff refused to let him in, which quite frankly was staggering. Despite our protests they would not even let him use the hotel restrooms. Their condecending and totally rude manner was appaling. In addition the room I stayed in was more like a prison cell and was the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in. I could strectch out and touch both walls!! The bathroom was so small i had to squeeze into the shower that had a non existent curtain allowing water to cover the bathroom floor. TRULY THE WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED IN

Reviews.Title: “Lovely decor and position but overpriced and 'underplumbed' so to speak.”
Reviews.Author: Cate-36
Reviews.Content: Lovely decor, although the room is very cramped, especially if you have more than one suitcase. Overpriced despite position. Air-con controls seemed to have no effect and often got stale cigarette smoke through the vent from other areas of the hotel. Cold breakfast was pretty poor for a hotel claiming 4 star status. (Ask to have a fresh coffee made on the machine rather than use their filter coffee.) Fantastic being so close to Trevi Fountain although makes area very busy, especially when taking luggage to end of street to get taxi. Porters were great but front reception staff were pretty unhelpful. No help when internet access in our room not working so we refused to pay for it. They were a little arrogant actually. Worst of all, bad drainage in shower and sink. Not sure if this is all Rome plumbing or just this hotel but if you don't mind showering in ankle deep dirty, soapy water, book here.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in rome”
Reviews.Author: franNorthEast
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome so I was careful about the hotel I picked. I did much research checking reiews which were mainly positive. I booked the hotel Trevi Botique online and e-mailed the hotel to request a taxi from the airport to which they promptly replied and it was cheaper at 50 euros. The hotel is in a busy street yet we heard no noise at all. The room was large with a small but adequate bathroom. There was air con which was a godsend! The dining area was in the basement and was small but the breakfast was good with lots of variety. The hotel is situated right next to the Trevi Fountain which was magnificent to see. The Colleseum was around a 20 minute walk or you could use the tube which is cheap. We took a guided tour of the Colleseum which I would recommend. The staff in the hotel were very friendly and helpful and they booked us a taxi back to the airport. It is in a central location with everything you need and I would highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: JulieBrez
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Rome. And I loved it. The hotel was in such a great location. Close to all the action and sights and shopping. I could not have asked for more. Even though the location is in a very busy area right by the Trevi Fountain, the noise was very very minimal. I was impressed with the staff and the service. I would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: HawaiianTraveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice. It was clean and new. I had two rooms which were both on the small side. The flat rate fee for movies and internet was a plus since I had my two teenagers and two younger children with me. I thought the location was perfect for people who want to experience a the loud night life that tourist bring to Rome. Plenty of gelato,pizza within walking distance. A small convenience shop (for bottled water, snacks etc) is steps away. My only disappointment was the front desk attendant who was thoroughly annoyed that I didn't have all our passports upon check in. I arrived at the hotel an hour before my luggage (a friend brought the luggage) and all the passports were in the luggage. He told me he couldn't believe that in America you can just check into a hotel with a driver's license and credit card. So, don't forget to have all guests passports in hand.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Hotel OK......”
Reviews.Author: TucksBath
Reviews.Content: Not sure this is really 4 star quality. Room was quite small (but probably ok given centre of Rome), but decor of dark wood panelling made the room seem very dark. Lots of small things were annoying: lights not fixed properly to wall, one plug socket hanging off, shower leaked onto floor, all power was shut off at 10am on the last day (had to waste time getting them to turn it back on). However, location is great, albeit noisy and in quite a tacky touristy area. Bed was big and comfy. Staff reasonably friendly and efficient although it took them 20 minutes to retrieve our bags when we stored them for a few hours on our final day. Breakfast was standard fare, but had to wait for a table one day as the room is small. Overall, we had a nice stay and its reasonable value for very central location but in my opinion not as great as other reviewers have indicated. On a more general note for UK visitors, the poor exchange rate means this will be a very expensive weekend break or holiday!!

Reviews.Title: “Would always stay here when in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Shellby26
Reviews.Content: Fab hotel in a fantastic location. Easy walking distance to everything worth seeing, great central point to start from. Rooms actually looked like the did on the net :) the staff were great and i could fault nothing....

Reviews.Title: “A Roman gem”
Reviews.Author: HWJ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for the wales v Italy rugby weekend, along with 8 other friends. E-mail replies to my enqiries about the booking (made through Venere.com) suggested that this was an efficiently run establishment, and we were not disappointed in our expectations. Our rooms were comfortably and tastefully furnished - with spa bath in the en-suite. The prima colazione (in the basment breakfast room) was good. Staff were friendly and professional. As to location, it could not be better -within 100 metres of Fontana di Trevi along a pedestrianised street. In Welsh, I would describe it in one word -"ardderchog".

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AndreaR80
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights in this hotel and it was ok. I don't think that they deserve 4 *,maybe 3*.The internet wasn't working properly (in one day it didn't work about 10 hours and another day 12 hours) but they charge me for the whole day (24 h/8 euro). The breakfast it's basic.I didn't have a shower gel in the bathroom,but it had a jacuzzi.The location is the best quality of this hotel,on a walking street full of shops,cafes and ice creams,very close to Fontana di Trevi (1 min).

Reviews.Title: “Guests mean nothing to them”
Reviews.Author: Helek
Reviews.Content: Before going to Rome, I've read on Tripadvisor that staff of the Boutique Hotel Trevi is unexperienced and they do not care about people. But this didn't stop me, because I couldn't imagine why guests would need their help so much. Now I know why. Although this hotel is situated 20 meters from goargeous Fontana Trevi, my stay at the hotel was horrible. It was february and +8 degrees at daytime, about 0 at night. So it was cold outside and to my surprise inside hotel also. The staff showed unexperienced and not welcoming from the first minutes, but I didnt pay attention. I went up to the room. It was very, very small, the size of an elevator, I think, and in the room it was very cold. In the bathroom it was just freezing, because the heating thing (not sure about the word in english) was cold. So The climate-control on the wall in the showed +15 degrees in the room, I turned to 30 and fell asleep for 3 hours. When I woke up, the temperature in the room was just the same. I went down and told the staff - I am leaving to do sightseeng, please do smth, so that when I return I could live in that room. 7 hours later I came back. The temperature was the same. I called the night reception, they said - nothing to do. I asked to bring the heater, they didnt have one. Plus there was no extra quilt in the wardrobe. So I went to sleep all dressed - sweater dress, poncho - all my clothes. In the morning I wanted to take shower - I couldnt. I was still freezing in the bathroom. I went to breakfast and caught their a woman, a manager and told her about my terrible night. She said - ah... room 406, I know, sorry. So that means that everybody knew about my problem and did NOTHING. That night was horrible. I felt like sleeping on a street, dressed and freezing. And that was, by the way, a 4 star hotel. They just dont care about guests. The breakfast is also of poor quality. I wish I chose some other place to stay or slept on a street.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: rubzCork
Reviews.Content: myself and my boyfriend just spent 2 nights in this hotel. i really wish it could of been longer as this hotel was so great. location could not been better just step outside and you could hear the fountain.A lot of the sites are within easy walking distance. i could not recommend this hotel enough. rooms were very very nice compare to other hotels we had looked at. the staff were so helpful and could not do enough for us.ill definately be returning to this hotel , hopefully within the next few months as i loved rome.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: AH1908
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with great location, rooms a bit small, the jacuzzi bathtub, well i would not discripe it as such as one person hardly can fit in it. breakfast is fine, staff is friendly room is clean. we will consider coming back

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: fifowkes
Reviews.Content: Guys!How can you not like this hotel? Only, I believe, if you are used to the the Las Vegas "palaces and pastiches of Europe". When you go to Rome/Italy, you go for the culture, history and way of life. In such a historic centre, you cannot expect a huge Hilton/Sheraton/Marriott/other American import (these are all available on the outskirts of Rome, but then where is the atmosphere??!!) This is a beautiful boutique hotel in the centre of Rome - 20 paces from the Fontana di Trevi. It has been very tastefully restored - our room looked over the main street, wherer we spent loads of time looking out of the window observing the tourists walking by - and was wood pannelled throughout with all mod cons such as plasma screen TV, internet, mini bar etc. Admittedly, the prices in the mini bar are a bit high, but check out the shop opposite the hotel where a lovely lady from the Philippines will sell you wine and open it for you to take back to your room - a much better prospect! We are serial visitors to Rome, having good friends living on the outskirts, but until this trip, we had always stayed with them or family. This time we were complete tourists, and can say that for reasonably fit people, all the major attractions are in walking distance (although at the end of a days walking the jaccuzi bath came in handy!). Fontana di Trevi - 20 paces (so near that after the first few times we stopped looking!); San Pietro - 1 hour walk which you must follow up by a visit to the top giving a spectacular view of Rome; Colluseum / Palantine/ Forum - (combined tickets valid over 2 consecutive days 12 euroes - a fantastic bargain) 15 minutes; Spanish Steps - 5 minutes; Piazza di Popolo - 15 minutes; Via del Corso - 2 minutes. I could go on........this place is so central, it is fantastic. Now a bit about the staff - all brilliant. I can highly recommend one of the concierges who knew everything. First night we asked for a recomendation for a good restaurant. He directed us to L'archetto (3 minutes walk) which we discovered was a restaurant we had visited a oouple of times before and loved - reasonably priced with a brilliant pasta and pizza repertoire. We then asked him to recommend a patisserie as we were going to visit our friends and wanted to take a small gift. No problem - out comes the map - "we are here - you need to go here - and here is a chocolate shop in case the patisserie is not what you want". Needless to say it was and we enjoyed the cakes that evening with our friends. All the staff in the hotel were charming and helpful - I guess it is all down to making a bit of an effort - speaking a few phrases in Italian and having a smile on your face! OK - breakfast - which some of our American and Canadian cousins have commented on! The breakfast room is in the basement, but is well lit and cheerful It is small (only about 16 tables) but at reception, when you check in, we were offered the option of breakfast in our room for free (!! unheard of!!) if we required. In the event, we went down to breakfast every day, and the only time we had to wait for a table was on Sunday morning. But hey - no problem - we went out for a short look at the Trevi, came back 10 minutes later, and hey presto! Table available we were on holiday after all! Good choice of meats, cheeses, bread, pastries, fruit and all the cappuchino you can drink - this is a continental breakfast - not American or British! When in Rome......... Occasionally, there was a slight smell of sewage - but then this city has been here since Roman times and so probably some of the drains have been too!
