You have the same thing in Venice - these are ancient cities so cut some slack! A tip ref getting coffee and food - don't stay on the main drag to the Trevi where an espresso can cost 3 euros - eeeekkk - come out of the hotel - turn right - at McDonalds (ugh) turn right - walk through a fantastic painted courtyard. On the right is a bar with espresso at 80 cents, on the left is a restaurant with house wine (very decent) at 10 euros a bottle, and the to the left of the restaurant, Michelle Pizza with (alledgedly) the best sliced pizza in Italy (we sampled and it was excellent!) at 1 euro per 100 gramms. So no need to spend a fortune! And a last thought - there are loads of street artists, but look out for the girl who is there at night. She makes the most fantasic paintings using spray paint - a bit like Rolf Harris - "can you see what it is yet?" at 10 euros each. Just go and watch for a real treat and to admire creativity. Oh, and another last thought - look out for the Gatti di Roma in the ruins - if you love cats they are fab. And one final - the ice cream - wherever you go - even in December - is FAB!!!!! This hotel was comfortable, beautifully decorated, location second to none, and the staff fantastic. I would highly recommend it to anyone, as long as you realise that you are in one of the oldest and greatest capitals in the world, and that not everything needs to be big/brash/new/corporate.

Reviews.Title: “Total disaster! Trevi definetly sucks!”
Reviews.Author: Real_Vacations
Reviews.Content: Dont even think of booking this crappy hotel, very rude staff including the whole management. Unexperienced reception, they could never help us no matter the situation. The hotel is extremely tiny and the rooms are incredibly small, you would think that for the amount of money you pay you would at least get free internet, NO its 15 Euros!. I stayed in 9 hotels during my 35 day vacation in europe and by far this was the worst. Breakfast is a total scam their was never space to sit and they would tell us to come back later, like if im going to be waiting around for an hour when im in rome for a short vacation. On top of that the few times we had a breakfast the food sucked, very bad bread, filthy eggs, artificial juice and the coffea was only good to spit out! Good location if you want to be in the center of the historical sites but very noisy, crowds of people at all times and to many street vendors hassasing you at all times. This hotel is extremely bad for the huge amount of money you have to pay, I have stayed in two star hotels where you get more out of your money. Dont you ever consider staying in this hotel or else your vacations will be a nightmare. Tripadvisor rules!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RoisinNewYork
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome on September 4th to stay for two nights and the hotel we have booked had a plumbing problem so they sent us over the the Boutique Trevi. We had a problem with the taxi driver who took us over to the Hotel - he had no english and the hotel that sent us in the taxi said they had taken care of the fare. Anyway, the receptionist at the Boutique Trevi was totally professional and sorted out the problem. She was extremely helpful. Our room was small but decorated nicely. We had a lock box and a refrigerater in the room. We also had a small balcony. I have to agree with other reviews about the shower. I had to build a dam with towels after getting out of the shower so the water would not flow into carpet in the bedroom. We could not figure it out at all but we were only there for 2 nights. The breakfast was the best during our stay at four different hotels in Italy. There was a great selection and the cappiccuno was the best. The Trevi Fountain was so close you could hear the water when you stepped outside the hotel. Hopefully we will be back in Rome soon and would definately stay at the Boutique Trevi again. We would also highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghJanet
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in July and thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this beautiful boutique hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The location of this hotel was excellent, just a few steps away from the Trevi Fountain. The Fountain was always very busy and noisy, however with the windows closed in your room you could not hear a thing. You could walk to all the tourist spots from this hotel as it was very central. We did not use the Metro or take a bus at all on this trip. Everything was within walking distance. The rooms were absolutely gorgeous, the furnishings were amazing. They have obviously been renovated recently and were a delight to stay in. There was a flat screen T.V. in the room which had internet access for a very small fee. The bathroom was lovely and had a jacuzzi bath, which I used each day after a long day of sightseeing. The air conditioning was most welcome. The breakfast room was small, but the breakfasts were amazing. Each day there was a huge selection of meats, cheeses, amazing bread rolls, pastries, cereals, boiled eggsand on 3 mornings there was hot bacon and eggs. The coffee was fantastic, they had a coffee machine where you just helped yourself. the cappuccino was great. I had 3 cups each morning. When I return to Rome, I will definitly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel”
Reviews.Author: ninaf
Reviews.Content: The good parts: Location, lots of restaurant by the hotel, bus service, trains are near by. If you want a taxi, let them call it for you. The A/C works great but only in the rooms. The hallways are NOT A/C. Some of the bad parts: First, there is a smell of sewage. My bathroom had this smell as did the spot outside the breakfast room. I am not sure what was up with that but I am so glad I don't have to smell it anymore. Second, the breakfast was good however one day an Italian family came in and took the toast basket. I asked the lady for some toast and she gave me about 8 pieces of toast. I had 2 pieces and took off. She ran after me and asked if I wanted my toast. I thought it was kind of odd. Third, it is a huge tourist spot. There are people everywhere. Be aware that getting out of the door can be hard. Fourth, the internet is insanely slow. If you are hoping to upload pictures, think again, It is about the speed of a 56K modem for 8 euro/24 hours. Fifth, the shower usually caused the floor to be flooded. I don't know what the deal is but I found it best to take the shower head off to shower. Otherwise, water leaks out onto the floor. Sixth, the ceiling as leaking water one day. It was from the a/c unit. I let the front desk know but they didn't do anything about it. So if you want a good location which is kind of nice... this might work for you.

Reviews.Title: “Hell near the Trevi Fountain”
Reviews.Author: WJM2008
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel may be OK, but it is a terrible place to stay! We booked two rooms at this hotel based on its website description and the description on the TD Canada Trust Travel Visa website - both listed the hotel as air conditioned throughout. It was NOT!! The halls were not air conditioned at all - the windows were open all the time! Worse, our rooms were like a Turkish bath. The thermostats were set at 5 degrees Celsius, but I think they were put there as placebos, and had no real effect on the temperature or humidity. The "air conditioning" blew hot air around the room, but did nothing to cool you off. In fact, it seemed to be hotter inside than it was outside (40 degrees Celsius)! We repeatedly requested the management to address this issue, but they were not really interested; their answer was that the air conditioning did not work when it was hot outside! We spent the (sleepless) nights trying to cool down by draping ourselves with wet towels! The only one who was any help was the one harried bellboy, who turned on the AC at 6:00 AM, when he arrived at work. It would go off again almost immediately, however. I paid a lot extra for the AC, and feel really cheated. In addition, the breakfast was totally pathetic - cold toast, stale buns, etc. This place was listed as one of the favorite hotels in Rome when we made our booking, but has since dropped considerably. Take heed of this warning!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MancUK_8
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Small room but well designed and very clean, staff very helpful, well priced. Fantastic location, within metres of the beautiful Trevi Fountain. We woke up early, walked to the Fountain at 7am and were the only people there; just magical. Located close to the Pantheon and Piazza Navona, less than 5 minutes walk from both. If you are staying there don't expect a big sign, as it's apparently been stolen, so there was just a piece of paper in the window with the name on it. Don't let that put you off, it's really great.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Rude Rude staff,an expensive shoe box”
Reviews.Author: nicole234
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the biggest rip off, the hot breakfast ran out on saturday 12th July at 8am. The drinks in the mini bar are very expensive, 8 euro for a gin and tonic be prepared to drink out of plastic cups. You can not get hot water for a cup of tea. The staff are so rude, no discount for cash. The rooms are so small you have to open the windows to let the light and air in, but it is extremely noisy. Beware the smell of sewerage close to the steps going to the breakfast area. I got sucked in by the comments on the site, which i think they have posted themselves. You can do better in Rome, it is the greatest city in the world do not ruin your time by staying here. Try Palazzetto Degli Artisti Suites a new property where they could not be more helpful, big apartmentys for half the price of this hotel and it is a great location with a fantastic place to eat in the same street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ruby7400
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boutique Hotel Trevi Fountain for the first part of our Honeymoon and loved it. The location is perfect, the rooms are small, but exactly what you expect in a city like Rome, and you just step out of the front door into all of the action. We walked to all the main sites from the hotel. The rooms are clean, comfortable and cool - a bonus when the temperature outside was so high. The breakfasts were good. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good”
Reviews.Author: vihti
Reviews.Content: Very central location. The street is very busy and crowded. The area though is nice, there are many restaurants around ( hotel is without the restaurant). Rooms are very small, but very clean, and bathrooms are clean too. Staff very helpful. The only area for improvement is coffe served for breakfast. If one needs to go the airport I recommend ordering taxi through hotel - cost the same as taxi, but it will better car.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: lfbourton402
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a 5 day trip to rome! i found it so hard to pick a hotel as there are so many and i had never been so i went by reviews!!! this hotel is absolutly exellent, all you could ask for, for a city break! location is great 30secounds from the trevi fountain, which is great if you go in the morning when quiet makes such a difference!!! the rooms are a really good size, enough room for a double bed, sofa, desk, chair. i was quiet concerned reading some reviews about room size we stayed in room 201 and had plently of room!! the bathroom is also good with a jacuzzi bath and shower, although the bath is quite small!! the hotel is residentail street so no traffic noise to worry about, and wen your shutters and windows are closed can hardly hear the outside world!! hotel staff were all really frindly and helpful and all speak good english! free buffet breakfast was nice with a good selection, ham, chesse, rolls, eggs, ceral, pasteries cakes, juice tea and coffee! breakfast room is an adequate size and is located in the basement. also if you have an early tour booked you get a breakfast bag to take with you!! the surrounding area is surrounded by restaurants, cafes and shops, you will not be short of any places to eat!!! getting around is fairly easy, spanish steps are about 10 mins walk, other attractions a little further by foot, although buses are easy yo use and nearest underground station is about a 5-10 min walk!!! our room had a computer and a flat screen tv, there are about 4 english channels and a selection of differnt music, films are extra but how often are you going to be watching telly??? this hotel is very light clean and welcoming and i would recommend it and would deffinatly stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “A compact gem”
Reviews.Author: WalkerTalker
Reviews.Content: Just 100 yards west of Trevi Fountain, on a narrow street heaving with tourists, this hotel was a lovely clean and quiet base from which to explore the main tourist sites of Rome. Within 30 mins stroll is the Termini main station (whence I arrived), the Pantheon, St Peters Basilica (get there before 07:30 to avoid the queues), Spanish Steps (I never saw the steps - they were always covered in tourists and street traders), and the Colosseum (well, maybe that's a bit more than 30 mins walk cos there's so much to see on the way). The hotel does a nice continental breakfast but doesn't have a bar or restaurant, which doesn't matter as there are so many places to eat nearby. Try Piazza Navona and Campo de Fiori, both about 10mins walk away, for restaurants, and street entertainers, artists etc. Terrific!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic find.”
Reviews.Author: slcMacc
Reviews.Content: We read lots of reviews of other hotels and dismissed many of them. The Boutique Trevi Hotel had hardly any reviews when we booked, so we were delighted when we realized we had found a little gem. Having stayed there, we agree with all the previous reviewers. The location is fantastic, it’s so close to the Trevi fountain that after the crowds had gone for the day you can actually hear it from your room. If you get up early enough you can have your fountain photos without the tourists, alternatively, go back late at night …a great time to get a gelato and appreciate the fountain lit up. You can walk to everywhere from the hotel so I can not recommend the central location enough. We found the hotel easily enough after catching the Leonardo Express train from Fiumicino airport and then 2 stops on the Metro to Barberini. From the Metro it is a short walk, just look out for the hotel entrance opposite the Blue Ice gelato place. We were early so our room wasn’t ready so we left our bags, had lunch and on our return they were already in our room. All the staff are professional and courteous. The hotel is in a pedestrian area so you don’t get any traffic noise. As we had requested a room on a high floor prior to arriving we didn’t get disturbed by the tourist noise. Our 4th floor room was a good size. It was beautifully decorated and very clean, there is a maid service daily. The view over the roof top opposite is charming and the shutters, windows, black out curtains and sumptuous drapes all ensured a good night’s sleep. There is a flat screen TV on which you can choose to listen to albums from contemporary artists for free. There is also a safe and mini bar in the room and plenty of wardrobe space with proper hangers. The marble bathroom had a Jacuzzi bath and powerful shower. There was a nice range of toiletries and as with the rest of the hotel it was spotlessly clean Breakfast is in the basement room which is small and we did have to wait for a table one morning for which the staff were very apologetic. There is a variety of cold continental buffet choices which are topped up continuously. There is a choice of juices and hot drinks and even Kelloggs cornflakes available if you fancy. We can recommend using the Antico Forno, go left outside the hotel towards the fountain, handy for good lunch snacks and drinks. The gift shop opposite the hotel entrance is expensive, buy your booze and pasta gifts at the airport instead. I would recommend all the usual tourist sites but just incase you are a cat lover, can I just mention the cat sanctuary at Largo di Torre Argentina. They look after the city’s abandoned cats and do a fantastic job. The cats are so friendly and love all the attention you can give them. Overall, Rome is fantastic and although the Boutique Trevi Hotel is not the cheapest option available it is good value for money, so if your budget allows I would suggest book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small property in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: klou50
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a big luxury hotel with spacious lounges and rooms this is not for you. But if you are looking for a lovely place to stay and feel the city of Rome then go for it. The boutique hotel is situated just a few steps from Fontana di Trevi in the lively center of Rome. You can walk easily from its front door to all the famous piazzas and the ancient sites as well. The people at the reception are friendly and helpful. They arranged for us taxi transportation to wherever we needed to go including a pickup from the airport. Please notice that the hotel is situated in a pedestrian street and the taxi can only take you about 15 m. from its front door. No problem with small suitcases. Due to our evening flight back home we asked for a late check out. They were really helpful accommodating us. We had three rooms. They let us keep one of them free of charge till 17.00 and a second one with just a 40 Euro charge. The rooms are small but very tasteful and with a feeling of luxury. Two of our rooms on the 5th floor were wood paneled and our other room on the 1st floor was painted in complementing pale colors. The furnishings were brand new and elegant as were the marble bathrooms. Our rooms had views either on the front street or over the tiled rooftops of Rome which to me gave a sense of the city. Very little storage space and wardrobes in the rooms on the 5th floor, more in the room on the 1st floor. It was adequate for us though, since we were there only for 4 days. Jacuzzi tabs in the bathrooms although we didn't really have time to use them. Continental breakfast was included in the price. It is served in a small but cheerful room at the basement. Not a big variety but quality items and options for all tastes (cakes, cheese, ham, tarts etc.). Also there is a machine for your to fix your drink and you can have a variety of coffees including espresso and cappuccino or tea. Overall Hotel Boutique Trevi is excellent for what it is. A boutique hotel and I would stay there again if I visited Rome. Some tips for restaurants we tried. First choice "alla Rampa" at the Spanish steps, Piazza Mignanelli (closed on Sunday). Another good choice near the Spanish steps is "34" at via Mario de Fiori. Also try Sabatino at the Piazza S. Ignazio, it looks like the locals eat there. Do not eat at the Quirinale Restaurant near the Hotel. Bad food not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, stay there!”
Reviews.Author: ALCW_8
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights at this lovely, fantastic hotel. The two of us stayed in a triple room more than big enough for two people and given it's location a generous size in comparison to elsewhere. literaly 30 seconds walk from the Trevi Fountain with your window open you can actually hear the water flowing, however it is a busy pedestrian street and with windows open can be noisy, with windows closed, silence prevails. Go armed with a good map and the address for your cab driver though, nobody seemed to know where it was when we arrived and it is easily misable when passing by, being nothing more than a doorway in the street. The hotel is extremely clean the rooms very comfortable, clean, and well decorated, a mini bar, internet, safe, and TV (not many English speaking channels, but your not in Rome to watch telly are you? be honest!!) the reception staff friendly and ever helpful and all spoke good English if your Italian is not up to scratch. The Hotel does not have a bar or restaurant but who cares when there are so many on your doorstep within a very short walking distance, Piazza Navona 20 minute walk is fantastic for sitting enjoying a cold glass and some nibbles as you watch artists at work and people passing by, but if you can't be bothered to walk that far, 10 minutes to the Parthenon and it's collection of street cafe's, and dozens of cafe's and restaurants before you even reach that if walking is just not your done thing. Cabs are in abundance, the hotel will call one for you if walking 2 minutes to the cab rank is too troublesome, or just stay local, plenty of tratorias, pizzerias and restaurants and cafe's / bars on the door step. There is a breakfast room serving a continental style breakfast with a good selection, and if you want, but just why you would want to I don't know, McDonalds, 2 minutes from the hotel door, but why? Please don't! Overall a lovely charming little hotel that you'd be a fool not to stay at.
